channel.title: Science, Innovation and Technology Committee — News

item.title: Government must take a stronger stance to disincentivise phone theft, Chair warns
item.description: The government has failed to act on using technological solutions to deter phone theft or hold the long-promised phone theft summit, a letter from the Home Secretary to the Chair of the Science, Innovation and Technology Committee reveals.

item.title: Costs of UK-US Pharma Deal will be met by DHSC, Science Minister confirms
item.description: The Science Minister, Lord Patrick Vallance, has provided further details of the recently announced UK-US pharmaceutical deal in a letter to the Science, Innovation and Technology Committee Chair, Dame Chi Onwurah.

item.title: MPs press government for clarity on the UK-US life sciences deal
item.description: The Science, Innovation and Technology Committee Chair, Dame Chi Onwurah, has written to the Secretary of State for Science, Innovation and Technology, Liz Kendall, seeking further details on the UK-US pharmaceutical trade deal.

item.title: Liz Kendall details government’s plans to tackle intimate AI deepfakes
item.description: The Secretary of State for Science, Innovation and Technology, Liz Kendall, has set out the UK Government’s plans to tackle the rapid rise of non-consensual AI deepfakes and AI ‘nudification’ tools.

item.title: Committee presses Government and Ofcom for details on action against AI intimate deepfakes
item.description: Dame Chi Onwurah, Chair of the Science, Innovation and Technology, has written to Ofcom and the Department for Science, Innovation and Technology seeking urgent clarification on its action to address intimate deepfakes generated by AI tools like Grok.

item.title: Life sciences: Science and Tech Committee presses government for details on US trade deal
item.description: The Science, Innovation and Technology Committee Chair, Dame Chi Onwurah, has written to Wes Streeting, Secretary of State for Health, and Liz Kendall, Secretary of State for Science and Technology, for clarity on the pharmaceutical trade deal with the US.

item.title: How can consumers be protected from harmful hair and beauty products and treatments? MPs launch inquiry
item.description: The Science, Innovation and Technology Committee today launches an inquiry to investigate the potential harms hair and beauty products and treatments can have on their users, and how to tackle those harms.

item.title: Government must make urgent changes to restore confidence of UK life sciences sector, Committee warns
item.description: Chair of the Science, Innovation and Technology Committee, has written to Health Secretary, Wes Streeting, to warn that urgent changes to the processes behind pricing and uptake of new medicines and health technologies are needed for confidence in UK’s life sciences sector.

item.title: TikTok fails to share evidence behind increased AI use in content moderation
item.description: The Science, Innovation and Technology Committee today publishes TikTok’s response to its Chair’s request for details on proposed staffing cuts to its Trust and Safety teams in the UK.

item.title: Science Committee asks TikTok for clarity about how it will keep users safe online if it slashes Trust and Safety staff
item.description: Today, the Science, Innovation and Technology Committee Chair, Dame Chi Onwurah, writes to TikTok to ask for clarity on proposed cuts to its UK Trust and Safety teams, which are designated to prevent harmful content and disinformation on its platform to UK users.

item.title: Government risks further harm if it doesn't take further action against viral spread of misinformation
